column4: hey, im having trouble repartitioning a  harddrive with gparted. a livecd running gparted reported erroneus data, whereas a livecd running ubuntu with gparted says the right thing, a 75gb ntfs drive but says it's dirty and needs a fsck/chkdsk, which I ran and there were no errors. it wont let me resize the drive, any ideas?
If it's an ntfs, have you run chkdisk from within windows?
no, I ran chkdsk from a bart-pe disk
